hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Lull Reversal on First Post-Holiday ETF Flow
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with confirmed holiday lull (low volume, low volatility), the first significant daily net inflow (>$50M) to US Spot Bitcoin ETFs following a holiday period triggers a 48-hour BTC price appreciation of at least +2.5%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods create pent-up demand and suppressed liquidity. The first meaningful institutional flow post-holiday acts as a catalyst, breaking the lull and attracting momentum traders. The low volatility environment amplifies the impact of the flow signal.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day rolling volume < 30th percentile of 90-day range
BTC 10-day realized volatility < 40th percentile of 90-day range
Confirmed US market holiday within previous 3 trading days
Daily net inflow to US Spot Bitcoin ETFs > $50M (first such occurrence post-holiday)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price increase of +3.0% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price decrease of -1.5% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals fail to achieve +2.0% within 48 hours, OR the average return per signal is negative over 50+ occurrences.
